H0.text: What, alternatively called milk acid, is produced in the human body in power exercises. Lactic Acid

H1.text: What, alternatively called milk acid, is produced in the human body in power exercises. Pyruvic Acid

H2.text: What, alternatively called milk acid, is produced in the human body in power exercises. Acetic Acid

H3.text: What, alternatively called milk acid, is produced in the human body in power exercises. E328

A4.text: During power exercises such as sprinting, when the rate of demand for energy is high, glucose is broken down and oxidized to pyruvate, and lactate is then produced from the pyruvate faster than the body can process it, causing lactate concentrations to rise.

A5.text: The name reflects the lact- combining form derived from the Latinë§¹ word lac, meaning 'milk'.
